body: What? Just post the config which has that?
Posting a config requires a restart, this option should only be there if there is an inotify client connected
The fact that we are unable to modify settings without restarting doesn't mean that we should add extra api calls as hacks around our incompetence.

Sorry, I should have split my sentence in two. It should also be non persistent, such that it will only be set if an inotify client is connected (although it would not cover a disconnect, but this won't happen too often I guess)

To me this sounds just like some black magic. If you are able to setup inotify, you should be able to adjust the rescan interval. This temporary runtime value perhaps makes sense, but I am not too comfortable with that.

I don't think it's too bad. I was thinking in terms of a parameter to /rest/scan, `/rest/scan?folder=default&next=86400` to reschedule the next scan into the future, once. I haven't looked at if that makes sense in the code yet. :) But it's not much worse than allowing a scan to be forced to begin with, I think.

Right, I don't mind extra parameters to functions we export. Given it's used once within the invocation of the function. If it's reused, then it should be a config value, and you should modify the config.

I would prefer not to have another version of the config which is now the runtime config not preserved between restarts.
